text:
I haven't quite figured out this bug.

At first when I had apache 2.0.48 working with PHP5 RC1 Everything worked 
fine. I decided to upgrade to 2.0.49 and PHP5 RC2. So I uninstall 2.0.48 and 
PHP5 RC1 and installed the recent version of both. The only edit's i've made 
to the config is the DocumentRoot, and the port number, and loading PHP5 as a 
SAPI module, and approprietly giving the right document extensions for it. I 
start it up, open my *.htm file and its missing the first 97 or so lines of 
the file. I figured maybe it was my error, and proceeded to upload the file to 
a remote server. It wasn't.

It apparently only happens with *.htm files. I have tried .txt files and no 
results. and Images do not show up. I tried downgrading to 2.0.48 (after 
uninstalling 2.0.49 and PHP5 RC2) without loading up PHP5RC2 into the 
httpd.conf and just changed the directory as per normal. Same effect. After 
many hours of frustration over this I took to IRC and tried troubleshooting, 
Nobody could understand it.

My initial file I was using in .htm was 6495 Characters long, and 160 lines 
long. I decided to test by putting 6k random characters into a file, And most 
of it was cut short. I moved to 5k, same effect. At 2k is when it didn't do it 
anymore. I also left the default dev port (8080) and nothing changed.

I am running Windows XP 5.1 SP1 2600
Pentium 4 2.53GHZ
2 sticks of PC2700 512MB DDR Ram

nd@perlig.de
text:
Could you try one of the following directives (single and/or combination) and
see if it helps:

Win32DisableAcceptEx
EnableSendfile Off
EnableMMap Off

Thanks.

Okay, this is getting a little weirder. I currently have all the directives 
André Malo suggested on. At 3k characters it shows the entire file. I figured, 
bug solved, right? I go back to my original file (6491 chars) and it's still 
cutting lines. I resumed testing, and it appears that at 4k chars it cuts off.
creator: MageOfChrisz@Hotmail.com
jim@apache.org
text: This is quite old. Please test/confirm with more recent versions and reopen if needed.

I can't really re-create the test scenario for this with the same setup (XP and
all its updates, etc.) and i haven't had a problem since since after this i
decided Linux would be more suitable for a proper environment.
creator: MageOfChrisz@Hotmail.com
